WRITING.TITLE: Pro MUAs: Do you need a cosmetology license to volunteer?
WRITING.TEXT: My friends and I want to start a volunteer program at university to give makeovers to patients at the local hospital. I know that a cosmetology license is necessary if you're starting any kind of business doing makeup, hair, and nails, but does anyone know if this applies to a volunteering organization and not profiting?
Why "the Reddit" instead of just "Reddit"?
Not to be a party pooper, but is making inside jokes within the descriptions actually a good idea?

This video is an awesome intro to a new youtuber for me! Being a smaller youtuber her setup isn't very sophisticated but you can tell she puts a lot of work into reviewing and researching the products. Plus her aesthetic and humour are both great. She really keeps it real.
I'm pretty sure there was an episode of HI where Grey says he uses a Yeti.
Sub stream games are different because at least he's interacting with chat. The backseating and him getting annoyed at the backseating are what make them fun.

my classmates pretend to care about these issues to look compassionate, but don't understand how mental illness affects behaviour.
Pretty much how I feel. Always reminds me of [that Hyperbole and a Half post about fish](http://hyperboleandahalf.blogspot.com/2013/05/depression-part-two.html). Hopefully I'll find people like you around who can truly relate :)

Yeah. I'm gonna get myself to my therapist again, pick up a hobby, and come up with better ways to keep myself focused and deal with my mental illness instead of letting it swallow me. And then I would be able to deal with my classes. Even if I still fail then I'll at least know that I tried my best.
Yeah, you're right. I should get back to counselling.
Thanks for the advice, I'll keep it in mind
Props for sharing your story. I hope we'll both get better.
Thanks. This thread really showed me that people do care.

thank you. Sometimes I feel like most people here are only freaking out because they are used to complaining about their workload as a form of humblebrag- this weird, exaggerated facade that getting an A- is ruining their lives. Most of the people I know here don't struggle with mental illnesses and when I try to open up to them, they can't relate on the same level (like on this subreddit) and equate it to the humblebrag. There is almost never true vulnerability. I know people like me are out there, maybe eventually I'll find one of them
Thanks for the encouragement
Will do, friend.
Thank you, I think the med school itself is something I can handle when I'm not constantly overwhelmed with mental health issues. When I get my brain back in order hopefully I'll do fine.

Yea, I have been diagnosed with OCD and other related anxiety issues, as well as depression. I've been bad at going to my therapist for the last few months (you have to call them every time to schedule an appointment. Who thought that was a good idea when a lot of the people who are supposed to be calling have severe social anxiety?). I know I should be going back though. Gonna book myself an appointment as soon as I can.

Thanks. I've always been the kid who was pretty above average at all the different creative outlets but wasn't really the best at any one of them. I don't have a "thing" that I stuck to and eventually it did make me feel like I didn't have a purpose. I think slowly adding one of them back at a time would be really good for me.

Thanks for the suggestion. Meds used to be a great option for getting through but losing my insurance recently it's been a little difficult to justify paying 200 a month when rent is still on the table :/ A part of my getting better is also getting my financial situation figured out.
I'm glad that worked for you, man. I used to have a lot of hobbies- art, played four instruments, tennis. Now I really haven't been doing much of any of them. Probably should pick em back up again.
I actually have taken away all the normal triggers like knives and scissors but a few days ago i got creative and cut with a metal ruler haha. Desperate times call for desperate measures

I'm a first year at johns hopkins, even more stressful since everyone around me has all their shit together and humble brags all the time. I think trying to not compare myself with other people is a really important step in getting better

I go to all my classes and try really hard to study all the time but focusing is still hard because my mind wanders even without touching the internet (which is why cutting has become a strategy to get myself to focus again) I feel like at this point dropping out is my only option which i know would make my parents furious. Hearing other people with similar experiences but still are chugging along makes me feel a lot better, so thanks.
thanks man. nice to know someone cares
i hate myself when i do it but sometimes it's the only way i can get my shit together and be productive for once. Thanks though.
[Here it is!](http://i.imgur.com/P2LyFoy.jpg )

Lips: KVD ELL in Damned

WRITING.TITLE: I don't know what I'm doing CCW

WRITING.TEXT: Currently accepting applications for cortex working group position

WRITING.TITLE: Don't look at that disgusting email notification number

WRITING.TEXT:
1. Most of the board games recommended here (betrayal, Eldritch horror, Dead of Winter) are referred to as "Ameritrash" games, as in they're big, garnish, usually luck based, and heavily themed. Their elements are used to create dramatic tension, to make you feel like every decision is big and important and make you win or lose. This is why they lend themselves to great co op, the sense of being a team with a single focus can heighten that experience. I think these are fun, but only when I'm with a group I'm really comfortable with. In general, I am more of a fan of Eurogames which run the gamut the other way - usually reward skillful playing, many interlocking game mechanisms, some to no luck at all, victory points as a measure of who is winning, no player elimination, and generally a pasted on theme. These games are all about elegantly and seamlessly threading mechanics into the core game. There are a lot of variables but none of them should feel heavy or overwhelming. Catan is a classic, and I really enjoy [Terra Mystica](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/120677/terra-mystica), [St. Petersburg](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/9217/saint-petersburg), [Ora et Labora](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/70149/ora-et-labora).
2. N/A
3. Co op games are really fun! The couple of issues I run into with with co op games:
*The "quarterbacking problem"-- If you ever play it with new people you're kind of forced into being the alpha-gamer, because there are optimal decisions that are obvious to you but unbeknownst to new players. Basically those who are too tryhard make the decision for everyone. [Hanabi](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/164236/witch-hunt) deals with well this by having hidden information.
*Elimination-- obviously no one wants to be kicked out of a game halfway through. Secret role games often suffer through this, but I think [Witch Hunt](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/164236/witch-hunt) does a fairly good job of keeping the roles interesting even when you're dead.
*Difficulty-- Hard to balance a game that works for all numbers of players. If a game says it plays 2-6, it shouldn't be impossible to beat with 2 and easy as hell with 6. Additionally, for some games you either lose near the beginning or steamroll so hard near the end that the last few rounds feel lackluster.
Basically I feel like the annoying parts of something like Dota or Overwatch are the same things that ruin a co op board game, magnified by the anonymity of online play.
4. Four players is the standard unless each turn is shot (e.g. [Seven Wonders](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/68448/7-wonders)) 5. I haven't played any :/ 6. Around an hour of a really intense game or 3 hours of a more casual game 7. [This article](http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/1268120#1268120) is one of my favourite things that summarizes board game design approaches.
8. Malf is better than okay. Malf is the best NLSS guest by a mile.
That seamless relay app just makes me wish everything can look like that
I think there is sometimes a perception that we're stingy or come to a store to just look at the testers. I also come from a smaller Midwest place, so I guess that's more common?

I'm so sorry that happened to you! Unfortunately a lot of makeup counters people are super judgemental when it comes to looks. there had been multiple times when I have walked into a makeup store and not been helped even when i explicitly ask. A lot of them have been accompanied by whispers of "She's Chinese so she's probably not going to buy anything."

I feel ya! But I'm the opposite, Im always on the hunt for a burnt orangey terra cotta that actually translates on my skin tone. Everyone suggests Lolita 2 and similar shades but it looks straight up peach on me

WRITING.TITLE: Due vs Alarmed
WRITING.TEXT: Can someone with experiences with both apps tell me which one they prefer for reminders? The two apps seem to have very similar functions. While Due is productivity cult favourite, it seems that the newest updates have been erasing user profiles and that seems like a frustrating experience. However, Due has a Mac client while Alarmed doesn't?

WRITING.TITLE: Marching band hazing
WRITING.TEXT: Heard it was a thing??? Here to confirm

This is pretty much how i found mindcrack. Yogscast, captainsparklez and the machinima group, seth, etho. For a while I've pretty much stopped watching content from anyone but mindcrack and friends, but lately since they're doing more and more videos with people like Parv and Captainsparklez, I've gone back to watching yogscast again. It has come full circle.

In my case, lots of my friends are all mindcrack fans, so their inside jokes become our inside jokes in our own friend group. The things the mindcrackers say are all extensions of existing memes (like dankey kang and spooky scary skeletons), which are already part of our daily vocabulary to begin with. It's actually made my conversations twice as fun :)
[Vi Hart!](https://m.youtube.com/user/Vihart)

I know you don't mean harm by the comment, but different people deal with stress differently. Guardax is a great guy and worked very hard for this community and might have his own reasons and problems with taking things the way he does. We don't have to agree, but we have to at least respect his decision and not take the motive behind it lightly.

I'd like to reiterate that I feel like there's nothing wrong with not being the loudest voice in the group. You're an amazing guy who is hilarious and extremely kind and respectful to others and work well in multiplayer situations. For example, your commentary during Friday Frag Fest (another thing I wouldn't miss for the world every week) or Team Ca$h Money, and your Quake Live with Coe are probably my favorite series from you I guess the thing is to do collabs with a smaller group of people. But maybe there's not that many problems as there are only a few big group stuff on the server once in a while. :)

I'm subscribed and watch your videos, but I tend to go with other perspectives when it comes to group events as you are usually not the most vocal of the group :/ Not that there's anything wrong with that, it's just that I would rather watch your solo/ with BTC stuff where you'd have more room to be heard.
